channel.title: Soul Talk Radio: Soul-casts
channel.description: A spiritual feast to leaven the world soul. Soul Talk Radio with host Chuck Freeman articulates spirituality from a pluralistic, universal perspective with relevance to current social and moral issues. The show offers a venue for listeners to share their sacred and ethical beliefs at the radio “table”, to be encouraged and spurred to action through positive expressions of faith, in a playful setting.
channel.itunes:author: Rev. Chuck Freeman

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Rev. Dr. Marie deYoung
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day One week ago today Major Nidal Malik Hasan is alledged to have opened fire on his fellow soldiers in Ft. Hood, Tx. killing 13 and wounding 31. Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - Rev. Dr. Marie deYoung was the first female Chaplain in the Army. She served 9 years in the armed forces with her last assignment being in Ft. Hood. She has written 2 books about her perspectives as a soldier including, “This Woman's Army: The Dynamics of Sex and Violence in the Military.”

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Rev. Gerald Davis
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - Rev. Gerald Davis is the Pastor of Restoration Unitarian Universalist Church in Tulsa, Oklahoma. The persevering Rev. has preached and taught religious freedom and racial justice around the country. Along with his congregation and the Center for Racial Justice, Gerald has worked to implement the recommendations of the Tulsa Race Riot Commission. Due to Tulsa governmental resistance the case went to US court and is now in the International court. Rev. Davis is a justice seeking man of God who shucks the gospel corn on the “One” at the G the A the P!

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Bruce Ledewitz
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - Bruce Ledewitz is the author of, “Hallowed Secularism: Theory, Belief, Practice.”   He is Professor of Law at Duquesne University School of Law in Pittsburgh, and is a recognized expert in the fields of criminal law and constitutional law. In August of this year Bruce was a panelist at the Netroots Nation workshop, “A New Progressive Vision for Church and State: How I Learned to Accept ‘Under God’ in the Pledge of Allegiance and Stop Losing Elections.” His provocative perspectives have been a catalyst for spirited debate from religious and secular camps. Bruce is putting the finishing touches on a new book, “Higher Law in the Public Square.”

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Islam Mossaad
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - Islam Mossaad currently serves as Imam for the North Austin Muslim Community Center in Austin, Tx. He has worked as an engineer, teacher, and principal. Islam has settled on the dynamic opportunities (and risks) that come with being an Imam in America. He is an avid longhorn fan and enjoys the diversity and openness of the people of Austin where he has lived most of his life. Islam believes that America, despite its flaws still holds great promise not only for Americans but indeed for the whole world.

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Paul Sullivan
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - –Paul Sullivan is the Executive Director of Veterans for Common Sense.  He served in Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and Iraq with the Army's 1st Armored Division during the 1991 Gulf War.  From 2000 to 2006, Paul worked as a project manager at the VA, where he led a team who produced the quarterly Gulf War Veterans Information System report as well as many other reports related to the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan. In addition to his work at Veterans for Common Sense, he is the Chairman of the Austin Veteran and Family Advocacy Council.  Paul is a life member of both the Veterans of Foreign Wars and the Disabled American Veterans. Paul lives near Austin, Texas with his wife and two daughters.

item.title: Soul Talk - "Heavy Burdens Hard To Bear"
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Food - "Heavy Burdens, Hard To Bear” Chuck asks the question, “How long will America the superpower be able to stave off an intergalactic spiritual law?” The Hearty Fare Dinner conversation with Jonalu Johnstone.

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with David Plotz
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - David Plotz always assumed that he knew all of the important parts of the Bible. What happens when this proud but not very observant Jew actually reads the entire text? - The birth of "Good Book: The Bizarre, Hilarious, Disturbing, Marvelous, and Inspiring Things I Learned When I Read Every Single Word of the Bible." This spiritual odyssey is sparked by genuine curiosity and a profound need to understand the foundation of his faith. David is the editor of Slate and the Hume award winner for political journalism.

item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. How many of you grew up singing this song? Hearty Fare Dinner Conversation with Valerie Mapstone Ackerman.

item.title: Soul Talk Interview with Michael Zimmerman
item.description: Soul Talk - "A Spiritual Feast to Leaven the World Soul" Fresh Off the Grill, From the Balcones Woods studio in Austin, Tejas. Streaming on the web everyday, live on Thursdays, 2-3 pm. CST on Progressive Blend Radio. Read Chuck's Soul Food Commentaries Join the Free Souls Social Network at http://freesoulsproject.ning.com/ Menu for the Day Soul Stirrer with embodied faith in action - Michael Zimmerman is Dean of the College of Liberal Arts and Sciences Professor of Biology at Butler University. As an ecologist, Michael focuses on plant-animal interactions, particularly those associated with pollination. Dr. Zimmerman also has a professional interest in science literacy in general and the evolution-creation controversy in particular. In 2004 he founded The Clergy Letter Project, an organization designed to demonstrate that religion and science are compatible. He is the author of “Science, Nonscience, and Nonsense.”
